intro: Habenaria chapaensis, commonly known as the Chapa orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
